nodes.text: @kylaTea @AGramuglia So it’s cool they turned the assassin of Wakanada’s King into a fun, silly meme? I think Marvel’s handed people a well written show. Thank you for coming to my TED Talk.
@HeroesRebound @kylaTea It shows he is a well-rounded character, yes. Especially considering, from his perspective, he is winning
@HeroesRebound @AGramuglia That wasn’t the point of the conversation? You said “why did race have to be brought up” and then messed around for like 20min talkin nonsense and MKUltrq

@AGramuglia @kylaTea I’m comparing Marvel’s writing on this show to Miyazaki not handing us lame, paper cutter villains, yes. Karli’s shown murdering people first, as or more cold blooded. By muddying the waters, the show’s a fascinating inkblot test....  a choose your own political agenda, lol.

@HeroesRebound @kylaTea Karli is still framed as in the wrong by killing people, even if she is 100% justified\n\nKarli is a sympathetic villain. Zemo is sympathetic. The Power Broker is even more sympathetic right now...than John. Walker. Though the last one is only true because they're just a name.

@HeroesRebound @AGramuglia Being Zemo looked like a dumbass with no rhythm but Walker isnt dancing to a song in a club. He’s out here going mad with power. Yet again the show is saying “hey maybe this dude isn’t great? Maybe don’t idolize him cuz he has the shield?” Which ppl seem to not understand
@HeroesRebound @kylaTea Are you comparing John Walker to Lady Eboshi? https://t.co/kXsWCszr0c

@HeroesRebound @AGramuglia And Ant is right it’s just like the cops who take their authority to levels beyond and when they get outta pocket ppl try to rationalize and empathize with why they did it. But his actions are pretty clear and not ok in the context of the show.

@HeroesRebound @AGramuglia And yes in the falcon and winter soldier race comes in to play a lot here! It’s part of why Sam doesn’t have the shield. Trying to remove that is taking a core theme of the narrative out

@AGramuglia @kylaTea ... and that, much like a Hayao Miyazaki film, we haven’t been handed a 101%, clear cut villain to all hate. Marvel released a loop of Wakanda’s King’s murderer dancing, can I hear you defend that please? But because it’s been done well, most people seem to enjoy the show.
@HeroesRebound @kylaTea But that's what he is. He is basically a cop.\n\nPower makes you more of what you are. He was always a bad person

@AGramuglia @kylaTea That may well be, but we hadn’t been shown him cross the murderous line that he has now. He ain’t MY Cap, but yes, some have seen this as an anti-hero origins story. If we see he and B.S. were killing kids in Afghanistan or torturing people, we ALL should hate them. We weren’t.

@AGramuglia @kylaTea That the show’s written well enough for some to have sympathized with Walker, as is evidenced by videos of many different BGs reacting to the episode on YT. That Marvel challenged the immediate notion that the character was simply the “white supremacist” Cap...
@HeroesRebound @kylaTea *Black people.\n\nAutocorrect is....weird.

@kylaTea You may be assuming *I* view Rorschach as “the hero”, I do jot. However, DC wouldn’t be releasing more and more Rorschach related comics, if SOME didn’t empathize or “get”/cross-wires to SEE him as the hero. Walker was written with empathy, and challenged assumptions, for a sec.
@HeroesRebound @kylaTea What in the Sam Hill are you talking about?
@HeroesRebound @kylaTea MKUltra and the privatized prison system disproportionately targeted Black in people.\n\n...what is your point here?

@kylaTea Tuskagee’s real. Then again, so was MKUltra, the military industrial complex, and privatized prisons, which have filled up fast with meth/opiate related whites, because the machine doesn’t care about race. Only power. I could point to Bucky getting arrested as “proof”.
@HeroesRebound The machine has race built into it what are you on about? Especially privatized prisons? The school to prison pipeline for black boys is a thing?
@HeroesRebound Once again, micro aggressions and yes they can come from black men too, and comparing him to Rorschach ain’t the thing you wanna start if you wanna make him seem more understanding.

@kylaTea I concur that he was condescending/rude. To be fair, they are 1st introduced by a black man as “some Grace Jones lookin chicks with spears”, I cringed even at THAT. However, he was clearly written to show he’s “not all bad”, and has fans like Rorschach did/does.

@HeroesRebound If you wanna understand him more and try to see his side of the character that’s fine but i take part with people missing the point and trying to rationalize his actions and make them ok. Cuz that takes away I feel from the explicit message the show is trying to make.

@kylaTea .. but I honestly don’t think Marvel made that swip-swap to make that point, merely to point out it’s well written enough that EVERYONE should be enjoying it. Except those with political agendas. And that’s still kinda cool, given the show’s premise, deft handling of plot.

@HeroesRebound Given the way the show has been playing into themes of systemic racism since the start and Walker literally belittled the weapons of the Dora Milaje which is a great example of a micros aggression, I gotta say nah.

@kylaTea Saw some black dudes on YT reacting, and their summary was, “I ain’t even mad at him (Walker),” even convincing his buddy (who hated Walker) to START sympathizing with him. Maybe this ISN’T a race thing, maybe they wrote Walker JUST sympathetic enough to confuse some viewers?
That’s it white men are forbidden from media analysis. When you miss the point this badly and you review media?? \nHell no. No. https://t.co/t0Viw6HKGb
@kylaTea Buddy got ratiod and now he’s trying to walk it back 😂 https://t.co/f85RcKqyFY
@kylaTea Why do I suspect John Walker will turn into Tyler Durdan?

@kylaTea That's what I don't get! These people are watching the show tell them that this is a bad thing (in case they couldn't get it on their own) and they're still acting like he's just another hero and/or equal to Steve Rogers. How are they missing the point this badly?
@CredibleHulk277 @kylaTea It’s because they’re fascists.
@CredibleHulk277 I can’t keep going through this. If it has a flag motif they will idolize it no matter what.
@kylaTea Fellas out here idolizing PG-13 Homelander?!?
@Tuosma https://t.co/ewLmxtorft
